title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.40 | 11-03-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: In the modern civilization, people think industries are generating many jobs, increasing the wealth of the nation, increasing the GDP and giving so many nice gadgets and facilities and machines for peoples. But actually, there is the negative side of this industrial development.
segments.summary: This segment discusses Queen Kunti's prayers to Krishna for prosperity and contrasts it with the speaker's view on modern industrial development and its negative consequences.

segments.key_quote: The more we attempt to exploit material nature according to our whims of enjoyment, the more we shall become entrapped by the reaction of such exploitative attempts.
segments.summary: This segment elaborates on the dangers of exploiting material nature and emphasizes the importance of accepting nature's gifts with God consciousness.

segments.key_quote: If the human civilization has sufficient grains, minerals, jewels, water, milk etc. Then why should we hanker after terrible industrial enterprises at the cost of the labor of some unfortunate men.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes the sufficiency of natural gifts and criticizes industrial exploitation, advocating for devotional service and obedience to the laws of the Lord.

segments.key_quote: So, by Krishna's mercy there will be prosperity because Krishna is directing material nature. Further Srila Prabhupada explains Kunti Devi mentions that the grains are abundant the trees are full of fruits the rivers flowing nicely the hills of minerals hills are full of minerals and the oceans are full of wealth.
segments.summary: This segment highlights the role of Krishna's mercy in providing prosperity and contrasts it with the artificiality of modern industrial developments, emphasizing the values of Vedic culture.

segments.key_quote: When sincere souls try to become Krishna's devotees, Krishna very kindly comes before them in his full opulence and glances upon them and they become happy and beautiful.
segments.summary: This segment describes how God's creation provides sufficiently and how cooperation between living beings leads to prosperity, emphasizing the importance of Krishna's glance and devotional service.

segments.key_quote: Simply by Krishna's glance, matter becomes agitated. And then becomes pregnant and gives birth to the living entities.
segments.summary: This segment explains how Krishna's glance is responsible for the creation of the material world and the birth of all living entities, referencing scriptures to support this point.

segments.key_quote: So therefore, simply by Krishna's grace. If we become devotees, if we become Krishna conscious, there will be no scarcity, we will have plenty and we will be having prosperity.
segments.summary: This segment concludes the lecture by reiterating that Krishna's grace, devotion, and Krishna consciousness lead to prosperity and the absence of scarcity.
